author: lagake.
content: <@!476250636548308992> as per your suggestion running it with the "--clear-db" flag got me syncing, so thank you!

author: lagake.
content: I delayed epoch 1462 on the Pyrsm chain for 12 minutes, if it helps anyone I find using "--verbosity info" to be the best for relative output for attacking the network with different ideas.

author: nishant0
content:
ah k, could you clarify this ? 
> I delayed epoch 1462 on the Pyrsm chain for 12 minutes

I checked the validator participation rate and it was still 100% from epoch 1462 onwards for the chain

author: lagake.
content: I probably interpreted disconnecting nodes as disconnecting from the network rather than only disconnecting to my IP. Would the best way to verify this be checking the beaconChain.db file? Or perhaps setting up another node separate from the one used for attacking for better live test data...?

author: djrtwo
content: I suggest looking at prysms http api. You can monitor things like vote participation and peer count

author: nishant0
content:
> I probably interpreted disconnecting nodes as disconnecting from the network rather than only disconnecting to my IP.
ah , that would only be from your node/ip.

author: nishant0
content:
you can look at our http api to monitor the node 
https://api.prylabs.net/

author: nishant0
content:
if you want to find the participation at that epoch 
```
curl -X GET "http://localhost:3500/eth/v1alpha1/validators/participation?epoch=1462" -H "accept: application/json" 
```

author: nishant0
content:
or 
```
 curl -X GET "http://localhost:3500/eth/v1alpha1/node/peers" -H "accept: application/json" 
```
to find all the connected peers in the network

author: ajsutton
content: <@!544848504078598144> My guess is Lighthouse is using snappy compression for gossip but your command line hasn't enabled it for Teku.  Try adding `--p2p-snappy-enabled`

author: adiasg
content: <@!340345049063882753> Nice catch! That fixed it! ðŸ™‚
